text: floral tributes grow outside the Emanuel
African Methodist Church in Charleston
as people pay their respects some chose
to express their emotions in words
others hugged nine people died here in a
racially charged case among them are
four herds wife Cynthia put this to take
place
it's very senseless because she's the
kind of person all of them in there only
wanted the betterment of all mankind
photographs have been published
appearing to show the suspect Dylann
roof burning the American flag holding
weapons and posing with a confederate
flag a symbol used during the u.s Civil
War by southern states opposed to the
abolition of slavery the images appear
on a website containing 2000 words of
racial hatred hundreds rallied last
night outside the South Carolina State
House against the flags presence calling
it a symbol of hatred not heritage I
think it's a terrible insult to the
black residents of the state of South
Carolina it's a symbol that they are
inferior citizens the police tape has
finally been taken away from the Emanuel
Church it reopens today when all nine
people who died here will be remembered
in a small private service Nick quraishi
BBC news
